title: CV
text: My full CV can be downloaded here.

title: Juliane Kloidt
text:
About me
I am a PhD candidate at the UKRI Centre for Doctoral Training in Socially Intelligent Artificial Agents, based at the University of Glasgow. My PhD project on “Thriving under challenges - how personal characteristics and situational context shape positive stress and behaviour change” is supervised by Prof. Lawrence Barsalou.
I also work as a research assistant with Prof. Tim Kaiser at the University of Kaiserslautern-Landau (RPTU) on establishing effects of behaviour change interventions (health, sustainability, and household finance), synthesising effects of capital vs training interventions on business outcomes, and investigating time preferences.
I enjoy teaching research methods, coding in R, and psychology classes, for the School of Psychology and Neuroscience (University of Glasgow), for instance at the Widening Participation Summer School.


Research Interests
Health behaviour change | Positive stress & well-being | Data science | Generative AI


Technical Skills
Coding: R (tidyverse, ggplot2, lavaan, psych, lme4) | Python (numpy, sklearn, scipy)
Workflows: GitHub | Jupyter | OSF
Generative AI: Huggingface | OpenAI API
